alert.note: Alert for Gove; Logan (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 8:11PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Logan and Gove Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 810 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northwest of Quinter to 6 miles west of Gove to 8 miles southeast of Russell Springs. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Logan and Gove Counties, including the following locations... The Monument Rocks. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 87 and 102. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for west central Kansas.
